sections.heading: Overview
content:
Arthur Croft, DC, is the director of the Spine Research Institute of San
Diego. He has been actively engaged in whiplash research for the past 18 years
and is the co-author of a best-selling textbook, Whiplash Injuries: The
Cervical Acceleration/Deceleration Syndrome , and Whiplash and
Temporomandibular Disorders: An Interdisciplinary Approach to Case
Management along with several other books, textbook chapters, and more
than 250 professional papers. He was the original developer of the now widely
used whiplash (WAD) grading system, as well as widely adopted treatment
guidelines for the condition. Croft wrote and produced the Emmy-nominated video
"Whiplash," and was the first chiropractic physician to conduct
full-scale human volunteer crash testing.

Croft is board certified in orthopaedics through the American Board of
Chiropractic Orthopaedists and in forensic medicine through the American Board
of Forensic Medicine. He lectures extensively in the United States and
abroad.
